newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thailand says China to buy rice, other commodities.
newsitem.headline: Thailand says China to buy rice, other commodities.

text.p: China has signed a memorandum of understanding to buy a massive quantity of commodities from Thailand, including 1.03 million tonnes of rice, Deputy Commerce Minister Chalermphol Sanitwongchai said on Monday.
The deal was signed during an official visit by Prime Minister Chavalit Yongchaiyudh to Beijing earlier this month, Chalermphol said.

In addition to rice, China also wanted to buy 520,000 tonnes of tapioca chips and starch, 382,000 tonnes of rubber, 10,000 tonnes of palm oil, 300,000 tonnes of asphalt and 98,000 tonnes of fruits from Thailand, he told reporters.
The purchase does not necessarily cover only 1997. The details of the purchases, including the prices and shipment periods, will be discussed in early May, he said.
"The trade can be done in any form they want -- government-to-government, government-to-private sector or private-to-private," Chalermphol said.
"The rice order from China is likely to help support the second crop rice which is flooding the market at the moment," he said, adding that China is seeking mostly high quality grade.
In return, Thailand will buy petrochemical products, electronics and mechinery from China, he said.
